comment: If you want a professor who replies quickly and answers all of your questions (during office hours) then he is NOT the guy for you. I don't know WHERE the "accessible outside class" came from
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: If you want a professor who replies quickly and answers all of your questions (during office hours) then he is NOT the guy for you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Labs are super easy if you follow the instructions. You have six days to work on the labs. The labs don't take very much time to complete. The lab is a lot easier than the lecture

Quizzes and tests are easy if you practice the lecture questions. My only complaint is that quizzes are open for 24 hours from noon til noon. I would prefer them due at midnight. There are quite a few quizzes, so make sure you don't forget to do one.

Took both lab and lecture online. Everything was open note. He answered emails quickly but only does so during his office hrs he gives you in syllabus. Only negative thing is that all the notes are pdf and there are no recorded lectures to walk you through visually. This was the tough part for me but even then this class is not difficult
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Took both lecture and lab, lab was way easier. I struggled with the lecture because it was on pdf, this course is tedious and math-based. The only thing that saved my grade was office hours. If you go to his office hours he shows you how to do everything very clearly and sets you ready to get a 100 on all his quizzes and tests. Great teacher.

I enjoyed the lab much more than the lecture, because he provides a video for each lab explaining what to do. For the lecture, only pdfs are provided but you don't have to get the textbook. Quizzes are open only from noon Thursday to noon Friday, which can get really inconvenient with other classes.

I took both the lecture and the lab for surveying, it is soooooo much better having him for the lab than lecture. He gives you all the material needed for the lab with clear instructions, examples, and plenty of time. Although he is strict on deadlines you are given two weeks to do them, with resources that coincide with the lab.

The class is graded based on quizzes, tests, and a final. The quizzes are two attempts however, the grade is averaged, test, and a final; nothing gets dropped. All lecture materials are given in PDF form. He could make the class easier but doesn't. This class is graded by a few things which makes the class harder when it could be done easier.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: He's good, very strict on deadlines! Make sure you have time set up between noon Thursday and noon Friday to take quizzes every week. Quizzes take about 30 minutes and you get two attempts, grade is the average of two attempts. So make sure to have about an hour set aside for that. Take notes of the lecture notes each week and do the labs early.

This class is entirely online, so I did not interact with him much, but he was very nice and easygoing when I did. Everything is very straightforward and because of that, he does grade pretty strictly. He doesn't curve or do extra credit, so make sure to take good notes and work the practice problems and optional homework if you want to succeed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Branham was a great teacher however the class itself was not great. Doing surveying online is a learning curve and a lot of time needs to be put into the class in order to learn something. We had a quiz every week over the lecture content (which was given by pdf form) and 2 attempts at each quiz and the attempts average together. Nothing drops.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: Professor Branham is a good person and professor. His assignments, quizzes, and exams are pretty straightforward. Do the work and get a good grade. He is accessible outside of class but can be a bit awkward to talk to. Overall, I enjoyed taking Surveying 1101 with him and would highly recommend him.

Branham is VERY strict on deadlines so please don't think you can mock up an excuse email. Besides that, he's very knowledgable of the course and is thorough with his expectations. He lays everything out so it's up to you to apply it in the correct manner. Take him if you're serious about the class, no joking around

I took him for Spring 2021. His labs were easy and corresponded with his lectures. I heavily recommend taking them together. Everything you need to know will be from his lecture. He tells you exactly what he wants and grades fairly. The class is very straight forward and he gives good feedback.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: No textbook was required. The course consisted of provided reading material for each chapter each week followed by a quiz due each Wednesday night and a final. He made the readings a very clear and thorough paraphrase from the actual text.The only reason why I have a B is because I bombed the first few quizzes from not knowing what to study for.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: I think Branham is the only professor that teaches SURV at Kennesaw, and it's clear that he knows what he's talking about. I took the lecture and lab online, and as long as you read the lectures, it's hard not to get an A.

I have nothing personally against him, but I would definitely not recommend taking his class if you work full-time.Quizzes & tests are due in the middle of the work week. And you have only 24 hours to complete them. You are required to read 8+ page lectures, with no video. You get 20 minutes for a 10 question quiz that requires complex math

Solid professor but a lot of work and can be confusing. He doesnt lecture and just gives reading assignments that u take quizzes on that have a very short time period. Good professor if u read and pay attention

Very straightforward instructions for each lab. He is always willing to explain if you don't understand exactly what to do. I think it would be more helpful to have an option to take the class in person but online is very easy.

Very old-fashioned which doesn't work very well in online learning. The quizzes and tests are due at noon randomly throughout the week. The tests and quizzes were free response on d2l with no room for error until people failed the first test and he switched to mostly multiple choice. Although it doesn't matter bc he is the only survey professor.

one of the best/easy professors ive had a ksu. this class was a breeze. everything is open note. he has already put all the things you would need from the book into the notes so you dont have to purchase the book. made a 100 on all 4 tests. has quizzes every week, and hw is for your own practice. he is always accessible for this class and the lab.

It would be a challenge to find another professor at Kennesaw that is willing work harder and longer than professor Branham to make sure that every student that wants to learn and work hard succeeds and learns the material. He is also a great mentor that is very happy to help students even for other courses. Just over all a amazing prof and Man.

Professor Branham is the best college professor I have had at kennesaw state university. He truly cares about his students and is willing to go out of his way to help you in any way he can. I did struggle on the timed quizzes bc 20 min isn't long enough for me personally but his lectures were straight and to the point. Great teacher highly recommen

It definitely helps if you have professor Branham for both the lecture and the lab. His explaining in lecture made the lab super easy. He goes into lots of details about the lab and you're in a group so you likely won't be confused. Make sure you show up prepared and follow his directions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Makes material really easy. If you go to class, you'll get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: His tests and quizzes are all open note. If you show up to class and take good notes, this class should be a breeze. If you are having trouble, he's always in his office and is willing to help. Branham is funny and makes class enjoyable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Great professor!! He has great lectures that make the lessons easier to understand than the book Take his class (and lab)!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: He's a good guy that knows his material very well.  He's good with partial credit and very straightforward with teaching concepts.  Do the homework and show up to class and this class shouldnt be a problem.
He is as straight forward as they come, I took him for survey 1 and 2. If you give effort in survey 2 you will get an A. He will make sure you can pass the LSIT exam and he loves surveying.
This dude is amazing, One of my favorite professors of all time. I am going to have a beer with this dude when I graduate. He demands a lot from you, but it is because he wants to see you succeed.

Show up, read the book, do your homework, and take notes and you'll be fine. Open note quizzes until he thinks y'all aren't doing the homework anymore. Make sure you have some AutoCAD civil 3d experience or know someone that does. He'll catch your stupid mistakes, but early enough to be fixed come final.

Branham is a great professor. He has a great sense of humor, and is very easy going. His lectures are clear cut and to the point. It's a lot of number crunching and being familiar with your calculator. Open book/notes quizzes and tests give no reason not to make an "A" in the class. The final project involved Civil3D and was the hardest part.

Prof. Branham is a great professor overall. Teaches you in a manner where you want to learn, and teaches it well. Can be a bit stern at times, but that's to motivate the students to do the work. Tests aren't too bad and are based off notes, HW, and quizzes. The final project consists of Civil 3D. You'll do fine as long as you put in the effort.

great professor,very knowledgeable, sacrastic at all times of the day. if he sees you trying he will definitely respect you. we got to use all our notes on our test in surveying 1. i will be taking him for surveying 2

A great surveying professor. The tests are based off of quizzes and homework given. You need to understand the concepts the most, if you do that then any question will be easy. Understand the quizzes and why the formulas work. You WILL learn how to survey in this class! Understand and ask questions if you don't and you will do fine!

If you want to learn about surveying, i strongly recommend you take his class. Made the subject very interesting, and made me want to learn a lot more about surveying. He is very helpful and funny,and he will make sure you understand the topic he is covering. MAKE SURE YOU KNOW THE DATE YOU ARE TAKING THE EXAM OR QUIZ OR ELSE HE WILL DEDUCT POINTS.
Respectable, no non-sense character which is awesome. Teaching wise, he's tough as nails! Enter at your own risk.
If you follow directions, do your homework, and read assigned sections BEFORE class, you should be fine. He will help only if you really try. DO NOT expect an easy A. very respectful professor.

I enjoyed his class a lot... He really tries to intimidate you on the first exam but if u use common sense and take your time it is easy. Made 100s on all the test by just checking my work. Requies basic but confident math skills. If you like being pampered and babied by teachers then he is not for you!

His class is hard, because he makes it hard.  His lectures are extremely fast, and do not really show you how the questions will be asked on tests or quizzes.  I would avoid this class if possible.  Like others said homework and quiz everyday.

Really good professor, all you have to do is show him that you are going to try in his class. Do your homework, he goes over it, the next class you have a quiz, so its a quiz every class. Make sure your quizzes are corrected cause you will use that on the test. As long as you try, you will enjoy this class. Really funny guy.

This class requires attendence because a quiz is given almost every day. Most tests and quizzes are open book. The professor teaches too fast and becomes impatient when students asks questions. He is very picky and will even take points off if you forget to put the date on your quiz. Other than that, the class is ok. I would avoid taking him again.

One of the best teachers ever. If you don't want to do homework don't take him. If you do the work and pay attention you will be fine, and actually learn a lot.  He tries to scare people in the beginning but its not bad.  He is very funny, and he makes it easy to pay attention during that long class. tests and quizzes are mostly all open book.

Great teacher, seems to really enjoy teaching. Has his own since of humor. Makes the class easy to understand and fun. However tests are very lenghty and many quizzes. Class is not mandatory but you can easily get lost because the material builds.
Too much work for just one class! and he is too full of himself. OMG

He WILL try and scare you off within the first thirty minutes of class.  He is a great teacher, just more serious about his teaching than most.  You get to use your book on everything (test, quizzes, final).  You HAVE to write down everything he does on the board not all the material comes straight out of the book.

I'm in Land Development Design.  He is always there to help since he is always in his office late.  He is also a nice guy.  You have to put in a strong effort in his class.  He's one of those professors who goes right by his syllabus.  Be careful at times.  He could give a test since the syllabus mentions it even though nothing was said about it.
oh my gush. thats all i have to say
Do your hw and understand it, the rest will be fine. follow his directions or he will take off points.  turn cell off.  You'll learn a lot.
